caption.p: Transmission intensity and seasonal time window of dengue epidemic potential in 10 European cities for (A) Ae. aegypti (B) Ae. albopictus. Intensity was defined as the averaged VC over the highest consecutive 3-months for each decade. Transmission window was defined as the number of months when the decade averaged VC was over the threshold value (0.2 day − 1). Historical temperatures (CRU-TS3.22 ( Jones et al., n.d.)) were used from 1901 to 2009. From 2011 to 2099, two emission pathways (CMIP5 ( Taylor et al., 2011, Warszawski et al., 2014)) were evaluated: RCP2.6 (i & ii) and RCP8.5 (iii & iv).
